content: The devs are clearly extremely busy (look at the #rss feed) -- I'm not sure this is a question which they will be prepared to answer. Documentation takes a lot of time to write, especially if you want to write it well. I'm happy to just keep waiting.
That said, there is already a significant amount of documentation in the lean 4 reference
hmm where is the lean 4 reference that you're talking about? i couldn't find it anywhere tbh
oh lol thought it was something entirely different. thanks
There's easily enough there to get you started -- I have made some small projects just by reading what is there and looking through some of the source code files like Prelude.lean and Core.lean.
